title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 1 Chronicles chapter 6 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 1 Chronicles Chapter 6.

questions.question: Who were the sons of Levi mentioned in 1 Chronicles 6:1?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 6:1 explicitly names the sons of Levi as Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.

questions.question: Who were the children of Amram according to 1 Chronicles 6:3?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 6:3 states that the children of Amram were Aaron, Moses, and Miriam.

questions.question: According to 1 Chronicles 6:10, who executed the priest's office in the temple Solomon built?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 6:10 identifies Azariah as the one who executed the priest's office in Solomon's temple.

questions.question: Who went into captivity when the LORD carried away Judah and Jerusalem, as stated in 1 Chronicles 6:15?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 6:15 tells us that Jehozadak went into captivity when Judah and Jerusalem were taken by Nebuchadnezzar.

questions.question: What were the names of the sons of Gershom in 1 Chronicles 6:17?
questions.explanation: According to 1 Chronicles 6:17, the sons of Gershom were Libni and Shimei.

questions.question: Who were set over the service of song in the house of the LORD after the ark had rest according to 1 Chronicles 6:31?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 6:31 states that David set the Levites over the service of song in the house of the LORD after the ark had rest.

questions.question: Who was Heman, the singer, a descendant of according to 1 Chronicles 6:33-38?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 6:33-38 traces Heman's lineage back to Kohath, one of the sons of Levi.

questions.question: According to 1 Chronicles 6:49, what were Aaron and his sons appointed for?
options: To offer upon the altar and make atonement for Israel
To lead the people in battle
questions.correctAnswer: To offer upon the altar and make atonement for Israel
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 6:49 explains that Aaron and his sons were appointed to offer on the altar and make atonement for Israel.

questions.question: Which city was given to the sons of Aaron in the land of Judah, as stated in 1 Chronicles 6:55?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 6:55 notes that Hebron and its suburbs were given to the sons of Aaron in Judah.

questions.question: How many cities were given to the sons of Gershom throughout their families according to 1 Chronicles 6:62?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 6:62 states that the sons of Gershom received thirteen cities from various tribes.

questions.question: True or False: 1 Chronicles 6:48 states that the Levites were appointed to all manner of service of the tabernacle of the house of God.
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 6:48 confirms that the Levites were appointed for all manner of service in the tabernacle.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Chronicles 6:28, the sons of Samuel were Vashni and Abiah.
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 6:28 lists the sons of Samuel as Vashni and Abiah.

questions.question: True or False: The sons of Merari included Mahli and Mushi as recorded in 1 Chronicles 6:19.
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 6:19 clearly states that the sons of Merari were Mahli and Mushi.

questions.question: Complete the verse from 1 Chronicles 6:18: 'And the sons of Kohath were, Amram, and _______, and Hebron, and Uzziel.'
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 6:18 gives the sons of Kohath as Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.

questions.question: Complete the verse from 1 Chronicles 6:59: 'And Ashan with her suburbs, and ______ with her suburbs:'
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 6:59 mentions Ashan with her suburbs and Bethshemesh with her suburbs.

medium.title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with trusting God's plan in times of uncertainty. Based on the genealogy of Aaron and his sons in 1 Chronicles 6, what biblical truth would you share about faith and obedience?
options: Faithfulness in family roles honors God’s design
Success depends solely on personal effort
God’s promises are limited to a single generation
Genealogies are irrelevant to spiritual growth
questions.correctAnswer: Faithfulness in family roles honors God’s design
questions.explanation: The detailed genealogy from Aaron to Zadok and Ahimaaz (1 Chronicles 6:3-10) shows God's faithfulness through obedient family roles, teaching us to trust God’s plan and be faithful to our calling.

questions.question: How does 1 Chronicles 6 teach us about perseverance through trials when Jehozadak was taken into captivity?
options: Trials mean God has abandoned us
questions.explanation: Jehozadak’s captivity (1 Chronicles 6:15) reminds us that God’s purposes are not thwarted by trials, encouraging perseverance and trust even in difficult times.

questions.question: A believer is seeking guidance on humility and serving others in church life. What example from 1 Chronicles 6 about the Levites’ roles would you share?
options: Levites were appointed to serve in all manner of tabernacle duties
Levites sought positions of power for personal gain
Only Aaron’s family served in holy duties
Service in the church was optional
questions.correctAnswer: Levites were appointed to serve in all manner of tabernacle duties
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 6:48-49 shows Levites faithfully serving diverse roles, teaching humility and dedication in serving the church community.

questions.question: How does the assignment of cities to the Levites in 1 Chronicles 6 illustrate biblical stewardship?
options: God provides resources to be managed responsibly
Land ownership is the ultimate goal of faith
Stewardship is unnecessary for spiritual leaders
questions.correctAnswer: God provides resources to be managed responsibly
questions.explanation: The Levites’ cities (1 Chronicles 6:54-81) demonstrate God’s provision and the responsibility to steward resources wisely for His service.

questions.question: Based on 1 Chronicles 6, what biblical principle can help a family maintain godly legacy and spiritual discipline?
options: Passing faith and service from generation to generation
Focusing on wealth accumulation above all
Ignoring family heritage in spiritual matters
questions.correctAnswer: Passing faith and service from generation to generation
questions.explanation: The genealogy of Aaron’s descendants (1 Chronicles 6:3-10, 50-53) emphasizes the importance of family legacy in spiritual discipline and service.

questions.question: When facing temptation to seek personal glory, how does 1 Chronicles 6 instruct us regarding work ethic and integrity?
options: Serve faithfully in your appointed role without seeking self-exaltation
Seek the highest position regardless of character
questions.correctAnswer: Serve faithfully in your appointed role without seeking self-exaltation
questions.explanation: Levites and priests faithfully served in their God-ordained roles (1 Chronicles 6:32-38), teaching integrity and humility in work.

questions.question: A believer struggles with contentment in service. What does 1 Chronicles 6 teach about contentment through the example of Levite service?
options: Contentment comes from fulfilling God’s appointed duties
Contentment depends on recognition by others
Service is only valuable with status
questions.correctAnswer: Contentment comes from fulfilling God’s appointed duties
questions.explanation: Levites served in various roles with dedication despite their different assignments (1 Chronicles 6:31-47), showing contentment in God’s purpose.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Chronicles 6, only Aaron and his sons were appointed to offer sacrifices and make atonement for Israel.
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 6:49 clearly states that Aaron and his sons were appointed to offer sacrifices and make atonement, distinguishing their unique priestly role.

questions.question: True or False: The Levites were given cities throughout Israel to serve and dwell in, as detailed in 1 Chronicles 6.
questions.explanation: Verses 1 Chronicles 6:54-81 describe the distribution of cities among the Levites throughout various tribes for their dwelling and ministry.

questions.question: How does the genealogy of Heman and Asaph in 1 Chronicles 6 inspire us in spiritual discipline and worship?
options: Worship requires dedication and a heritage of faithfulness
Music and worship are unimportant in faith
Worship is a casual activity without discipline
questions.correctAnswer: Worship requires dedication and a heritage of faithfulness
questions.explanation: The detailed lineage of musicians like Heman and Asaph (1 Chronicles 6:33-42) highlights disciplined worship as an important spiritual practice.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling to forgive and reconcile within their family. How does the family record in 1 Chronicles 6 encourage us about reconciliation and love for neighbors?
options: Maintaining family unity honors God and strengthens faith
Family divisions are to be ignored
Reconciliation is unnecessary for spiritual growth
Love should only be shown to outsiders
questions.correctAnswer: Maintaining family unity honors God and strengthens faith
questions.explanation: The emphasis on family lines and service (1 Chronicles 6:1-19) encourages believers to value reconciliation and love within the family.

questions.question: How does 1 Chronicles 6 teach us about generosity and stewardship through the Levites’ assigned cities?
options: The Levites were entrusted with cities to manage for God’s glory
Only personal wealth matters in stewardship
Cities were given to Levites for their private gain
Stewardship is irrelevant in spiritual life
questions.correctAnswer: The Levites were entrusted with cities to manage for God’s glory
questions.explanation: Verses 1 Chronicles 6:54-64 show that the Levites were given cities with their suburbs to steward, demonstrating God’s call to responsible generosity.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to 1 Chronicles 6, the sons of Kohath included Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and ____.
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 6:2 and 6:18 state that the sons of Kohath were Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel, highlighting God’s detailed record of family lines.

questions.question: According to 1 Chronicles 6, how does the example of Aaron's descendants serving in the temple instruct us about integrity in daily work?
options: Serve with dedication and follow God's commandments faithfully
Ignore duties if they seem difficult
Seek personal gain over God's service
Work without regard for spiritual discipline
questions.correctAnswer: Serve with dedication and follow God's commandments faithfully
questions.explanation: The priestly line of Aaron (1 Chronicles 6:3-10, 49-53) exemplifies faithful service and integrity by following God's commands in their ministry.

questions.question: A believer is discouraged by lack of recognition for their church service. What does 1 Chronicles 6 teach about humility and contentment in serving others?
options: Serving in God’s appointed role is valuable regardless of recognition
Recognition is the only measure of service
Only leaders deserve honor in the church
questions.correctAnswer: Serving in God’s appointed role is valuable regardless of recognition
questions.explanation: Levites served faithfully in various roles (1 Chronicles 6:31-47) showing humility and contentment without seeking personal glory.

hard.title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 1 Chronicles Chapter 6.

questions.question: Which three sons of Levi are first mentioned in 1 Chronicles 6 as the progenitors of the Levitical families?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 6:1 and 6:16 clearly list Gershon, Kohath, and Merari as the sons of Levi, establishing the main branches of the Levitical families.

questions.question: Who among the following is NOT listed as a son of Kohath in 1 Chronicles 6?
questions.explanation: Phinehas is listed as a descendant of Eleazar (son of Aaron), not directly as a son of Kohath (1 Chronicles 6:2, 6:4).

questions.question: The genealogy of Aaron's descendants is traced down to which figure who went into captivity?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 6:14-15 states Jehozadak went into captivity when Judah and Jerusalem were carried away by Nebuchadnezzar.

questions.question: Which historical event is alluded to in the captivity of Jehozadak mentioned in this chapter?
options: The Return from Exile under Cyrus
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 6:15 references the carrying away of Judah and Jerusalem by Nebuchadnezzar, which is the Babylonian Exile.

questions.question: In the context of the Levitical families, which of the following roles is described as being appointed to Aaron and his sons?
options: To offer upon the altar of burnt offering and incense
To serve as musicians before the tabernacle
To lead the tribes in battle
questions.correctAnswer: To offer upon the altar of burnt offering and incense
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 6:49 specifies Aaron and his sons offered upon the altar of burnt offering and incense and performed the work of the holy place.

questions.question: Which of the following Levitical families was specifically assigned the role of service by song in the house of the LORD?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 6:31-33 describe David setting the sons of Kohath, including Heman and Asaph, over the service of song in the house of the LORD.

questions.question: What is the significance of the cities given to the Levites as described in 1 Chronicles 6?
options: They were cities of refuge and places for Levitical habitation
They were royal capitals for the kings of Israel
They were military fortresses for defense
They were trade centers for Israelite commerce
questions.correctAnswer: They were cities of refuge and places for Levitical habitation
questions.explanation: Verses 54-81 describe the allocation of cities to the Levites throughout Israel, including cities of refuge, emphasizing their role in religious and judicial functions.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Chronicles 6, the Levites were given cities only within the tribe of Judah.
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 6:61-81 show that the Levites received cities from various tribes, not only Judah, including Manasseh, Issachar, Asher, Naphtali, Reuben, Gad, Zebulun, and Benjamin.

questions.question: Which Levitical family received cities from the tribes of Issachar, Asher, Naphtali, and Manasseh in Bashan?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 6:62 states that the sons of Gershom were given cities from the tribes of Issachar, Asher, Naphtali, and Manasseh in Bashan.

questions.question: The detailed genealogies in 1 Chronicles 6 serve what primary literary and theological purpose for the Chronicler's audience?
options: To establish legitimate priestly and Levitical authority
To provide a historical narrative of battles
To describe the laws given at Sinai
To recount the building of Solomon's temple
questions.correctAnswer: To establish legitimate priestly and Levitical authority
questions.explanation: The Chronicler emphasizes genealogies (1 Chronicles 6) to legitimize the Levitical priesthood and their role in temple worship, especially post-exile.

questions.question: Which priest mentioned in 1 Chronicles 6 is noted for executing the priest's office in the temple Solomon built in Jerusalem?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 6:10 identifies Azariah as the priest who served in Solomon's temple, linking the genealogy to temple worship history.

questions.question: The repeated listing of the sons of Levi in 1 Chronicles 6 (verses 1 and 16) is an example of which literary device?
questions.explanation: The double listing of Levi's sons in verses 1 and 16 shows parallelism, providing structural reinforcement of Levitical lineage.

questions.question: What does the Hebrew name 'Phinehas' (mentioned in 1 Chronicles 6:4) historically signify in the context of priestly lineage?
options: A zealous priest who stopped a plague
The first high priest after Moses
A Levite who rebelled against Israel
A king of Israel from the tribe of Levi
questions.correctAnswer: A zealous priest who stopped a plague
questions.explanation: Phinehas is known from Numbers 25 as a zealous priest who stopped a plague, highlighting priestly zeal and covenant faithfulness, tied to the genealogy in 1 Chronicles 6:4.

questions.question: Which of these cities given to the sons of Aaron is also described as a city of refuge?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 6:55 and 6:57 identify Hebron as both a city given to the sons of Aaron and a city of refuge, indicating its special judicial role.

questions.question: True or False: 1 Chronicles 6 describes that the sons of Merari served on the right hand during the service of song in the house of the LORD.
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 6:39-43 describe the sons of Kohath and their descendants standing on the right hand, while 6:44-47 say the sons of Merari stood on the left hand, opposite to the sons of Kohath.

theological.title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: Who were the sons of Levi as mentioned in 1 Chronicles 6?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 6:1 and 6:16 clearly list the sons of Levi as Gershon, Kohath, and Merari, establishing the Levitical family divisions. This genealogical detail aligns with Exodus 6:16-25 and Numbers 3:17-20 which also outline Levi's descendants.

questions.question: Which son of Levi was the father of Aaron and Moses?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 6:2-3 identifies Kohath as the father of Amram, who fathered Aaron and Moses. This matches Exodus 6:18 and Numbers 26:57, confirming Kohath as the key ancestral figure for the priestly line.

questions.question: Which of the following was NOT a son of Aaron according to 1 Chronicles 6?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 6:3 lists Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar as sons of Aaron, but Moses was Aaron’s brother, not his son. This distinction is supported by Exodus 6:20 and Leviticus 10:1-2.

questions.question: Who among Aaron’s descendants served as the priest in Solomon’s temple?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 6:10 identifies Azariah as the priest who served in Solomon’s temple, highlighting the continuation of the priestly lineage. This is corroborated by 2 Chronicles 26:17-18 and Ezekiel 44:15.

questions.question: What significant event happened to Jehozadak, son of Seraiah?
options: He went into captivity by Nebuchadnezzar
He built the temple in Jerusalem
He led the Israelites into Canaan
questions.correctAnswer: He went into captivity by Nebuchadnezzar
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 6:15 states that Jehozadak was taken captive when the Lord carried away Judah and Jerusalem by Nebuchadnezzar’s hand, a critical moment in Israel’s history pointing to exile and judgment, paralleling 2 Kings 25:18-21 and Jeremiah 29:10.

questions.question: Which tribe was assigned the city of Hebron as their dwelling place?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 6:55 mentions Hebron was given to the sons of Aaron for their dwelling place, affirming the priestly cities assigned to the Aaronic line, consistent with Joshua 21:11-13.

questions.question: How many cities were given to the sons of Gershom throughout their families?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 6:62 states the sons of Gershom received thirteen cities from the tribes of Issachar, Asher, Naphtali, and Manasseh, reflecting the Levites’ distribution across Israel, as also seen in Joshua 21:23-26.

questions.question: What was the primary role of Aaron and his sons compared to the other Levites?
options: Offer on the altar and make atonement for Israel
Serve in the temple with song and music
Administer civil law among the Israelites
questions.correctAnswer: Offer on the altar and make atonement for Israel
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 6:49 clarifies that Aaron and his sons were appointed to offer sacrifices and make atonement, distinguishing their priestly duties from the other Levites, as also established in Leviticus 8 and Hebrews 7:23-28.

questions.question: Who was appointed over the service of song in the house of the LORD after the ark had rest?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 6:33 introduces Heman, son of Joel, as one appointed over the service of song, an important role in worship, consistent with 1 Chronicles 15:17 and Psalm 88 heading.

questions.question: Which Levitical family was assigned cities in the tribes of Reuben, Gad, and Zebulun?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 6:63 notes that the sons of Merari received twelve cities from the tribes of Reuben, Gad, and Zebulun, illustrating the territorial distribution of Levites, also reflected in Joshua 21:29-33.

questions.question: What does the genealogy of Aaron’s descendants in 1 Chronicles 6 emphasize about God's covenant?
options: The continuity of the priestly line
The end of the Levite priesthood
The rise of kingship over priesthood
questions.correctAnswer: The continuity of the priestly line
questions.explanation: The detailed genealogy in verses 4-15 highlights God's faithfulness in preserving the priestly lineage through Aaron, underscoring covenant continuity, paralleling Exodus 28:1 and Hebrews 7:11-17 about priesthood perpetuity.

questions.question: Which of the following cities was NOT listed as a city given to the sons of Aaron?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 6:57-59 lists cities given to Aaron’s descendants including Libnah, Jattir, and Bethshemesh, but Gezer was assigned to the sons of Kohath (verse 67), showing distinct allocations of cities among Levites.

questions.question: Who was the son of Elkanah mentioned in the context of the service of song?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 6:33-35 traces Heman’s lineage through Joel, son of Elkanah, highlighting the hereditary nature of Levitical worship service, consistent with 1 Samuel 1:1 and 2 Chronicles 29:25.

questions.question: What role did the Levites, other than Aaronic priests, have in relation to the tabernacle and temple service?
options: All manner of service of the tabernacle
questions.correctAnswer: All manner of service of the tabernacle
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 6:48 states that the Levites were appointed for all manner of service related to the tabernacle, supporting the biblical teaching of Leviticus 10:8-11 and Numbers 3:5-10 about their dedicated roles.

questions.question: Which Levitical family received cities from the tribe of Issachar?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 6:62 identifies the sons of Gershom as receiving cities from Issachar among other tribes, correlating with Joshua 21:23 and illustrating the Levites’ territorial distribution.
